author: redbeardlegoman
title: Noble Defender of the Desert Kingdom
review:
This wonderful minifigure is often cited as a lame one.  I beg to disagree.

Honestly, I'm very easy to please with the CMF lines.  I like variety, and that's enough to keep me buying all of them.

However, my like for this minifigure goes well beyond that.

I could see him easily paired with a twin guard, forbidding entry to the Caliph's chamber, or protecting the treasury from theives.

I could see an infantry of these guys locked in battle with Crusaders and rival kingdoms.

I like the green turban, and the hint of pointed boots.  The bare chest is a nice touch, rarely seen on warrior figures.

But mostly, I'm pleased to get some minifigures of a Middle Eastern origin.  One day, I plan to build a Museum of History in my City, and I would love to have more than just Egypt representing the varied people of that region.  I would love to see even more minifigures inspired by Arabs, Persians, Israelis, the various people of Africa, and more.

I really hope this is just the first of many more to come.

author: Odeinoichus
title: Defend the Desert
review:
Set #71013 Desert Warrior: Here's another great little historical warrior figure similar to the Egyptian Warrior or many others before him.

Desert Warrior features dual-molded legs with minor printing for a sash which carries down from his torso print which is a bare-chested look with a belt and strap. This print is dual-sided, his face is plain and simply with a small beard and mustache. Using the new turban in dark green completes the overall look and presenting a brand new massive scimitar-like blade for him enhances his appearance. (I believe this blade is new, though it may have first seen use long ago in the Orient Expedition sub-theme, or at least be a new piece inspired by the older blade.)

Overall this is a pretty decent offering and a great looking army builder for fans of large displays and MOCs with generic looking soldiers. He's got some good parts too, so I definitely recommend picking this one up.
